attributes.action: Sort out schools making children stay home for 48 hrs when there well enough
attributes.additional_details: We are not allowed to take children on a five day holiday yet if a child is sick for one day they are made to stay home for three in total, there is no excuse for this to take place when u penalised parents for taking there children out of school for holidays and u penalise us for low attendance but the schools are contributing to there attendance rate by making us keep them home
attributes.background: The government set a standard attendance rate of 94%. Schools make you keep a well child at home for 48hrs after a child is sick, when they are perfectly well enough to return to school, this is 48hrs of missed education that will child's potential. This needs to stop

rejection.details:
This appears to be a decision for individual schools and not the UK Government or Parliament. You could speak to the school directly about its sickness policy. 

You may find this NHS guidance helpful: http://www.nhs.uk/Livewell/Yourchildatschool/Pages/Illness.aspx
